snippet: With voters focused on the economy, Sunday’s presidential election in Mexico could offer rehabilitation to the Institutional Revolutionary Party, once dismissed as corrupt and authoritarian.
abstract: Mexican voters, focusing on the economy, are widely expected to favor the Institutional Revolutionary Party in the country's upcoming presidential election; party, once dismissed as corrupt and authoritarian, is experiencing renewed popularity following seven years under the National Action Party in which crime ran rampant and income inequality increased.

byline.contributor: Elisabeth Malkin contributed reporting from Mexico City.

lead_paragraph: With voters focused on the economy, Sunday’s presidential election in Mexico could offer rehabilitation to the Institutional Revolutionary Party, once dismissed as corrupt and authoritarian.

headline.seo: Pocketbook Issues Weigh on Mexico Voters
headline.main: Pocketbook Issues Weigh Heavily as Mexicans Vote
headline.print_headline: Pocketbook Issues Weigh Heavily as Mexicans Cast Their Ballots
